alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 1:17PM CST until January 02 at 1:45PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST FOR NORTHERN MCCURTAIN COUNTY... At 117 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 16 miles northwest of Broken Bow, or 35 miles west of De Queen, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bethel, Battiest, Mount Herman, Sherwood and Glover. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
